title: Woman arrested for ‘distracting drivers’ by twerking on top of moving car
text:
Myscellent Christina Shelton-Cox was arrested for twerking on top of a moving car in Nashville, Tennessee (Picture: Metro Nashville Police Department/ The Joe Padula Show Facebook)

A woman was arrested for distracting drivers after she was spotted twerking on top of a moving car, police say.

Myscellent Christina Shelton-Cox, 23, was filmed getting down on the roof of a silver Mustang in traffic on September 20 in Nashville, Tennessee.

The incident reportedly occurred as her vehicle traveled east on Antioch Pike through an intersection of Blue Hole Road, police wrote in an arrest affidavit.

Authorities said Shelton-Cox ‘was unrestrained and her actions were causing other motorists to divert their attention.’

‘The defendant caused undo hazard to other motorists whereby she could have fallen and been struck by other vehicles in the area or her own vehicle.’

However, Shelton-Cox said she was just having a good time and did not mean to break any laws.

She said: ‘I take chances in life because at the end of the day, there’s too many rules. We’d been sitting in traffic for 30 minutes, waiting on the train.’

‘I told my friend to drive my car, hopped on the car, did my little dancing and you know, just having a good time. I’m going to put on a little show, you know. I’m in traffic anyway. Why not turn up in traffic? I have balance and I does (sic) it before, so I know what I’m doing.’

She added that she has been in trouble for dancing on a moving car before, saying: ‘They said it was a crime and I don’t want to go to jail for being stupid and then I got to get bonded out and I ain’t ever been to jail in my life so why do I want to do that being stupid.’

Shelton-Cox is due back in court next month.
